Hello.

I have a zulip instance running on a Ubuntu 20.04 VM. All works as expected, but i have to change the ip address of this machine. I think that i have to do the following things:

  • edit /etc/netplan/01-netcfg.yaml and there, i have to change the ip, gateway and dns nameservers.
  • Remap the ports from the public IP to the new local IP.
  • restart the machine.

Â¿I have to do something else?

regards.
@Marcos Matas Sobral there shouldn't be anything special that you need to do on the Zulip side to change the IP address; we just require working DNS.
